title: Do Not Draft list: McCaffrey, Andrews among players being overvalued
content: The annual hit is back, with players Eric Karabell feels are going earlier than they should in fantasy football drafts.

title: Sources: Broncos, DL Allen agree to $102M deal
content: The Denver Broncos are signing All-Pro DL Zach Allen to a four-year, $103 million deal that includes $69.5 million in guaranteed money, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Quinn: McLaurin request business, not distraction
content: Commanders coach Dan Quinn says wide receiver Terry McLaurin's trade request is not a distraction, calling it a normal part of business in the NFL.

title: Ledecky bests McIntosh in 800 free showdown
content: Katie Ledecky remains the gold standard in the 800-meter freestyle, winning a gold medal Saturday at the swimming world championships in Singapore in a time of 8:05.62.

title: Yanks newcomers implode in 13-12 loss to Marlins
content: Newly acquired relievers Jake Bird and David Bednar each gave up home runs as the Yankees couldn't protect the lead in a 13-12 loss to the Marlins.

title: A defensive end? Parsons asks Cowboys for trade
content: Cowboys star defensive end Micah Parsons announces in a social media post that he has requested a trade amid stalled contract extension talks.

title: Track star Richardson arrested in alleged assault
content: Sha'Carri Richardson, the reigning 100-meter world champion, was charged with fourth-degree domestic violence after an alleged incident at the Seattle-Tacoma International Airport.

title: Spurs captain Son to leave club after a decade
content: Tottenham captain Son Heung-min announced in Seoul on Saturday that he will be leaving this summer following a decade with the North London club.

title: The Terry McLaurin trade request, explained: Why it could linger, and which teams should be interested
content: The Commanders' star wide receiver wants a new extension -- or a new team.  Can they justify paying him? And what could they get if they dealt him?

title: Expert picks, best bets: How Taira can avoid an upset loss at UFC Fight Night
content: Din Thomas makes his pick for Taira vs. Park and a betting insider finds value bets on this weekend's MMA cards.

title: NBA fact or fiction: Was Draymond right about the end of free agency?
content: Did the CBA ruin NBA free agency? Bobby Marks plays "fact or fiction" with some of the offseason's most impactful trends.

title: Who makes the Year 2 leap? The top 10 sophomores to watch for the 2025-26 season
content: From top 10 picks to Year 1 breakouts, who are the most interesting players to watch in their sophomore season?

title: New Hall of Famer Antonio Gates was a beloved teammate, remains a San Diego legend
content: Gates transformed the tight end position, and he remains remarkable to those who witnessed his exploits. Watch the Pro Football Hall of Fame enshrinement ceremony at 1 p.m. ET on ESPN.

title: Solak's annual ranking of all 32 NFL coaching staffs: A new No. 1 and No. 32 ahead of the season
content: We used past performance, future expectations, in-game decision-making and more to rank coaching staffs.

title: 'We thought it was dead': How Washington beat the odds -- and its past -- to return to RFK
content: Owner Josh Harris grew up watching Washington in Super Bowls and is thrilled to renew that history with a move back to RFK.

title: Which Man United players need to impress Amorim?
content: A number of Manchester United's squad are facing a crucial season as they look to prove they can be part of the club's future.

title: Arsenal's preseason Asia tour in review
content: Arsenal's preseason tour featured the arrival of a new star striker and the emergence of a bright prospect.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Al Nassr offer Fernandes a Ronaldo reunion
content: Al Nassr are pushing to sign Manchester United midfielder Bruno Fernandes and Cristiano Ronaldo could play a part. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Arsenal still open to Eze deal
content: The summer transfer window is open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could get done?

title: It's time for The Ocho! Check out the 2025 schedule, plus how to watch every event
content: It's time for the 2025 edition of The Ocho! Check out how to watch T-Rex races, paintball, dog surfing and more alternative events on ESPN now.

title: Lapsed fan's guide to 2025 SummerSlam: Two-nighter has something for everyone
content: Our FAQ guide on the latest WWE storylines, including John Cena's final SummerSlam and Jelly Roll's debut.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Where every team stands post-trade deadline
content: There was a lot of action across baseball ahead of Thursday's trade deadline. How did the moves impact each club's standing?

title: The 7 biggest surprises and disappointments of the WNBA season
content: From the Valkyries surpassing expectations to the Aces falling short on theirs, here's what we didn't see coming.

title: What to know ahead of the Hungarian Grand Prix
content: Formula 1 heads to Budapest for round 14 of the 2025 season. Find out the stats, session times and predictions for the last race weekend before the summer break.

title: 'Some coaches have no idea': The uncertainties of recruiting in the new rev-share era
content: The uncertainty surrounding how programs will pay players is directly affecting the timeline for high school prospects.

title: Risers and fallers: Fiebich trending up, Griner struggling
content: Leonie Fiebich has made the most of her increased opportunity on the Liberty, while Brittney Griner continues to have a down season.

title: South Carolina to Illinois: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 6 quiz
content: From Florida to North Carolina, the "SportsCenter" 50 state tour continues. We're back for our penultimate quiz of the summer.

title: 'Must remain alert': PM Modi's 'Swadeshi' appeal for Indians; days after Trump's 25% tariff
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has called for a renewed focus on 'Swadeshi' amid global economic instability. Speaking in Varanasi, he urged Indians to prioritise locally-made products, emphasising the need for national unity and economic self-reliance. Modi cautioned against inward-looking trade policies of other nations and stressed India's commitment to becoming the world's third-largest economy.

title: 'Only mistake I made ...': What Revanna said before he got life sentence in rape case
content: Prajwal Revanna, the suspended JD(S) leader and grandson of former Prime Minister HD Deve Gowda, has been sentenced to life imprisonment by a special court in Bengaluru for a rape case involving a 47-year-old woman. In addition to the imprisonment, Revanna was fined Rs 10 lakh.

title: 'No oil reserves in Pak': Baloch leader says Trump 'gravely misled' by Asim Munir
content: Baloch leader Mir Yar Baloch cautioned Donald Trump in an open letter, asserting that General Asim Munir misled him regarding Balochistan's resource ownership. He clarified that the oil, gas, and mineral reserves Trump mentioned belong to the 'Republic of Balochistan,' not Pakistan. Balochistan opposes any exploitation of its resources without the Baloch people's consent, emphasizing their sovereignty.

title: Mark Zuckerberg meets 24-yr-old AI researcher who rejected Meta's $125m job offer
content: Meta's aggressive pursuit of AI dominance led them to recruit 24-year-old Matt Deitke, initially offering $125 million, which he declined. Zuckerberg's personal intervention resulted in a revised $250 million package, including potential $100 million in the first year. Deitke, known for his work on Molmo and founding Vercept, is a highly sought-after AI talent.

title: 'Was tortured to name PM Modi, Yogi & Bhagwat': Pragya Thakur's big claim in Malegaon blast case
content: Sadhvi Pragya states coercion in naming leaders. A special NIA court acquitted all seven accused in the 2008 Malegaon blast case. The blast resulted in six deaths and numerous injuries. The court cited lack of evidence against Pragya Thakur. Investigations initially pointed to "saffron extremists". The case saw twists, including allegations against the NIA.

title: First in Test History! Yashasvi Jaiswal's ton powers India to historic milestone
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's century in the fifth Test against England propelled India to a historic milestone, equaling the record for most hundreds scored by a team in a single Test series. India's dominant batting performance, led by Shubman Gill's record-breaking run tally, saw five batters surpass 400 runs, solidifying their command in the series.

title: ‘Bid to implicate Hindutva leaders': Shinde backs Pragya in Malegaon blast; slams Rahul
content: Maharashtra's Deputy CM Eknath Shinde defended Pragya Thakur's claims of torture during the Malegaon blast probe, accusing the UPA government of framing Hindutva leaders and coining the term 'saffron terrorism'. Shinde supported Thakur's allegation that she was pressured to implicate PM Modi, criticizing Rahul Gandhi for allegedly echoing Pakistani sentiments.

title: LinkedIn cofounder, Silicon Valley's biggest democrat supporter says: There's a problem with Blue states and…
content: Reid Hoffman admits that the Democratic Party alienated Silicon Valley. This drove tech leaders towards Donald Trump. He says attacks on cryptocurrency and Big Tech companies caused this shift. Hoffman points to California's regulations as a problem. He notes companies like Aurora Innovation tested in Texas due to better rules. He urges Democrats to adopt business-friendly policies.

title: 'If irresponsibility has a face': Sitharaman slams Rahul, calls Jaitley remark 'despicable'
content: Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman has strongly condemned Rahul Gandhi's remarks about the late Arun Jaitley, deeming them irresponsible and harmful to the Congress party. Gandhi claimed Jaitley threatened him regarding opposition to farm laws, a claim refuted by Jaitley's son, Rohan, who pointed out his father's death preceded the laws' introduction.

title: Kab Banoge Crorepati? In how many years can you get Rs 1 cr with Rs 25K monthly investment - explained
content: Achieving a ₹1 crore corpus requires disciplined investing, with the timeline varying based on the chosen investment avenue. While bank deposits offer safety but take over 20 years, equity funds can potentially reach the goal in just 12 years, albeit with higher risk.

title: Tejashwi targets EC with 'EPIC' barb over 'missing name'; poll panel, BJP hit back
content: Tejashwi Yadav ignited a political controversy by alleging his name was missing from Bihar's voter list, accusing the Election Commission of a conspiracy to manipulate voter rolls. He questioned the deletion of 65 lakh names and demanded transparency from the EC.

title: Microsoft stops 30-year-old practice and drops Apple, IBM, Meta, Nvidia from its list of ...
content: Microsoft has stopped naming its competitors, such as Apple and Google, in its latest annual report, ending a nearly 30-year practice. The company now broadly describes the competitive landscape, citing the fast-moving nature of the markets. While executives still monitor rivals, this shift breaks from peers like Apple and Meta, who continue to name competitors.

title: IND vs ENG : Shubman Gill creates history; breaks Sunil Gavaskar record
content: Shubman Gill's impressive stint as India's Test captain concluded at The Oval, marked by a standing ovation despite his dismissal for 11. He amassed 754 runs in the series, the second-highest by an Indian batter, only behind Sunil Gavaskar. Gill also became the second captain after Don Bradman to score 750+ runs in their debut series as Test captain.

title: Pakistan: Shell blast kills 5 children, injures 12; sparks panic among residents
content: A devastating incident in Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province resulted in the deaths of five children and injuries to twelve others when an old mortar shell exploded. The children discovered the unexploded shell in nearby hills and unknowingly brought it to their village, where it detonated while they were playing with it.

title: IND vs ENG: Jaiswal, Crawley and Pope caught in fiery exchange - Watch
content: India dominated the morning session on Day 3 at The Oval, reaching 189 for 3 at lunch, fueled by Akash Deep's surprising 66 and Jaiswal's unbeaten 85. Tensions rose as Crawley and Pope confronted Jaiswal, seemingly frustrated by his perceived time-wasting. With a lead exceeding 100 and a flat pitch, India aims to capitalize on England's bowling shortage.

title: 'Detonate atom bomb': Rajnath mocks, dares Rahul to share EC 'vote theft' proof
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has strongly criticized Rahul Gandhi's claim of possessing evidence of election malpractice in Bihar. Addressing a gathering in Patna, Singh urged Gandhi to reveal his so-called 'atom bomb' of evidence immediately. He also defended the Election Commission's integrity and highlighted Nitish Kumar's role in Bihar's transformation, contrasting it with Congress's past actions like the 1975 Emergency.

title: Watch | Gill, Gambhir's priceless reactions after Akash Deep's 50: 'Smile says it all'
content: Akash Deep's remarkable 66, achieved as nightwatchman, ignited celebrations in the Indian dressing room during the fifth Test. His partnership with Yashasvi Jaiswal surpassed a significant milestone, becoming the 18th century stand of the series. Gautam Gambhir and Shubman Gill's visible pride underscored the innings' impact, boosting India's lead and denting England's morale.

title: IND vs ENG: Gill reaches big milestone, falls just short of Gavaskar's historic record
content: Shubman Gill etched his name in cricketing history by surpassing 6000 international runs during the final Test against England. He amassed 754 runs in the series, averaging 83.78, and notching four centuries. Gill's stellar performance broke records, surpassing Gavaskar's captaincy mark and nearing his all-time series record, solidifying his status as a modern great.

title: Nightwatchman Akash Deep breaks records; outshines Gautam Gambhir with fifty in England
content: Akash Deep's remarkable 66 as nightwatchman alongside Yashasvi Jaiswal's anchoring innings has solidified India's position in the fifth Test at The Oval. Their century partnership, a series highlight, surpassed a record set in 2003-04.

title: 'Desh ka raja kaisa ho, Rahul jaisa ho' slogans at Cong event. Here's how he reacted
content: At a Congress Legal Conclave in Delhi, Rahul Gandhi rejected chants of him being the 'king' and launched a strong attack on the Election Commission of India. Gandhi alleged the 2024 Lok Sabha elections were rigged, claiming the electoral system is 'dead'.

title: Spirit of cricket: Are India, England the worst-behaved teams in Test cricket?
content: The India vs England Test series has sparked debates over the spirit of cricket, with India accumulating more ICC demerit points. Sri Lanka statistically emerges as the worst-behaved team in the last two years, while England, Australia, and South Africa have the fewest demerit points. Despite recent tensions, England ranks among the best-behaved teams, and India sits in the middle.

title: Watch: Rohit Sharma arrives at The Oval as India make strong start on Day 3
content: Rohit Sharma, former India captain, was seen at The Oval on Day 3 of the crucial fifth Test, boosting fans' spirits. India started the day strong, with Akash Deep's surprising resilience and Yashasvi Jaiswal's continued form, reaching another half-century.

title: 'Stay out of the way': Shastri, Atherton slam Akash Deep's send-off to Duckett
content: During the fifth Test at The Oval, Indian pacer Akash Deep's demonstrative send-off to Ben Duckett sparked controversy. After dismissing Duckett, Akash Deep put his arm around the batter, prompting disapproval from commentators Michael Atherton and Ravi Shastri. They cautioned against physical contact, citing potential escalation and the importance of respecting boundaries in a non-contact sport.

title: 'Saiyaara' box office: Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda’s film earns around Rs 3 cr on Saturday
content: Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda's 'Saiyaara,' directed by Mohit Suri, continues its box office reign, nearing Rs 300 crore after 16 days. The film earned Rs 2.84 crore on Saturday, totaling Rs 287.84 crore. Despite new releases like 'Son of Sardaar 2' and 'Dhadak 2,' 'Saiyaara' maintains a strong performance, outperforming 'Dhadak 2' in early earnings.

title: 'Gives bowlers no time to settle': Sidhu compares Jaiswal's impact to Sehwag
content: Navjot Singh Sidhu lauded Yashasvi Jaiswal, drawing parallels to Virender Sehwag's impactful opening style. Sidhu highlighted Jaiswal's aggressive yet composed approach after his quickfire fifty against England. He emphasised Jaiswal's ability to dominate bowlers and put his team in a winning position, praising his technical strengths and comparing his impact to Sehwag's after Sunil Gavaskar.

title: Uttarakhand: Landslide hits Vishnugad-Pipalkoti project site; 8 injured
content: A landslide at the Helang dam site of the Vishnugad-Pipalkoti hydropower project in Chamoli district injured eight workers on Saturday. Rescue teams swiftly responded, providing medical assistance and transporting the injured to various hospitals. While four are being treated at the THDC Hospital, others with more severe injuries have been referred to specialized medical facilities, with no fatalities reported.

title: 'I love to play for the country' says Siraj on playing all five Tests vs England - Watch
content: Driven by passion, Mohammed Siraj embraces responsibility in the ongoing England series, dismissing concerns about physical strain. He took 4/86, matching Prasidh Krishna's figures, as India bowled England out for 247. Siraj's key wickets included Root and Brook. India ended Day 2 at 75/2, leading by 52 runs, with Jaiswal unbeaten on 51.

title: 'Farm laws introduced in 2020': Arun Jaitley's son on Rahul Gandhi's accusations
content: Rahul Gandhi alleged that Arun Jaitley threatened him over farm laws, sparking a strong rebuttal from Jaitley's son, Rohan. Rohan Jaitley refuted Gandhi's claim, stating his father passed away before the laws were introduced and emphasized his democratic nature. He also urged Gandhi to be cautious when speaking about deceased figures, referencing a similar incident involving Manohar Parrikar.

title: Himachal flashfloods: Cofferdam bursts at power site; vehicles swept away in Kullu
content: Relentless monsoon rains in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district caused the collapse of a cofferdam at the Malana-I Hydropower Project, triggering flash floods and sweeping away heavy machinery. The incident has exacerbated the monsoon's devastating impact, leaving hundreds of roads blocked, power transformers failed, and water supply systems non-functional.

title: ‘Dhadak 2’ box office: Siddhant Chaturvedi & Tripti Dimri starrer earns Rs 5 cr on Saturday
content: This Friday witnessed a cinematic clash with 'Son Of Sardaar 2', a desi comedy starring Ajay Devgn and Mrunal Thakur, edging out the romantic drama 'Dhadak 2' featuring Siddhant Chaturvedi and Triptii Dimri. 'Son Of Sardaar 2' is nearing double-digit earnings, while 'Dhadak 2', a remake exploring societal evils, saw a slower Saturday, collecting ₹1.

title: 'Operation Akhal': 2 terrorists killed in J&K's Kulgam; joint operation under way
content: According to officials, a joint team of the Jammu and Kashmir Police, Army and CRPF launched a cordon and search operation in the Akhal forest area of south Kashmir’s Kulgam district on Friday. The action was based on specific intelligence inputs about the presence of terrorists in the area, a police official told news agency PTI.

title: Messi to visit Kolkata, Ahmedabad, Mumbai and Delhi - complete itinerary
content: Lionel Messi plans to visit India in December 2025. The Argentine captain will tour Kolkata, Ahmedabad, Mumbai, and New Delhi. He will unveil a 70-foot statue and participate in 'GOAT Cup' events. Messi will conduct masterclasses with children and meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The tour includes events at Eden Gardens and Wankhede Stadium.

title: Nagpur woman marries 8 men, blackmails them for lakhs
content: Sameera Fatima got arrested in Nagpur for allegedly marrying eight men and extorting money. She targeted married men, gained their trust, and then filed false harassment cases. She extorted lakhs of rupees from each victim. Ghulam Pathan, her last husband, filed a complaint leading to her arrest. Police caught her at Dolly Ki Tapri with Pathan's help.

title: 'Atmosphere of global instability': PM Modi's message amid US trade stand-off
content: Amid escalating trade tensions with the US, Prime Minister Modi asserted India's commitment to prioritizing its farmers, small industries, and youth welfare. He urged citizens to embrace indigenous goods, emphasizing economic self-reliance and paying tribute to Mahatma Gandhi. Modi also issued a strong warning to Pakistan following a terrorist attack, vowing retaliation and dedicating it to national pride.

title: Rape case: Revanna breaks down in court again; pleads for minimum punishment
content: Prajwal Revanna, the former Hassan MP and grandson of HD Deve Gowda, was convicted of rape and other offenses against a 47-year-old domestic worker in a Bengaluru special court. Revanna broke down in court on Saturday following the verdict, which included charges of sexual harassment, voyeurism, and destruction of evidence. The court is scheduled to announce the sentence later today.

title: Rahul says EC 'obliterated & taken over'; claims 15 seats were rigged in LS elections
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has launched a scathing attack on the Election Commission, alleging that India's election system is 'dead' and the recent Lok Sabha elections were rigged. Gandhi claims to possess irrefutable proof of electoral malpractice, including manipulated voter data, which he plans to reveal soon.

title: 'Bhagwa, Sanatana aur Rashtra ki vijay': Pragya hails Malegaon case verdict
content: Pragya Singh Thakur, former BJP MP, declared her acquittal in the 2008 Malegaon blast case as a victory for 'Bhagwa, Sanatana and Rashtra,' accusing Congress of fabricating the lawsuit. The NIA court acquitted all seven accused due to the prosecution's failure to establish the case beyond a reasonable doubt.

title: Gujarat teacher kills sons, self over wife’s affair; woman, her lover booked
content: Alpesh Solanki, a PE teacher in Surat, tragically ended his life and those of his two sons, driven to despair by his wife Falguni's alleged infidelity with Naresh Rathod. Police arrested Falguni and Rathod for abetment to suicide after Solanki detailed the affair and mental torment in a suicide note, diaries, and video recordings.

title: Watch: UP cop offers milk and flowers to floodwater entering his home
content: A Prayagraj police officer, Chandradeep Nishad, was captured on video worshipping floodwater outside his home, as monsoon rains intensify across northern India. Nishad, seen offering milk and flowers to the water he calls “Mother Ganga,” shared the video on Instagram.

title: Couple abandons 10-year-old son in Barcelona airport to catch flight on time
content: A couple reportedly left their ten-year-old son at Barcelona airport. The parents discovered his passport had expired. They boarded their flight home without him. A terminal worker shared a video criticizing their actions. Airport staff found the boy alone and alerted the police. The parents were located and taken off the plane for questioning.

title: India still buying oil from Russia: Report rebuts Trump's 'good steps' claim
content: Despite Trump's claim that India has ceased oil imports from Russia, government sources confirm that Indian refiners continue to purchase Russian crude, driven by economic factors like price and logistics.

title: Bengaluru Metro Makes History with First-Ever Organ Transport
content: History was made in Bengaluru after Metro officials successfully facilitated the transport of a donated human liver for transplant.

title: Agra-Born Arvi Bahal To Fly To Edge Of Space Aboard Blue Origin Mission
content: Arvinder Singh Bahal, a US-based investor originally from Agra, is set to fly aboard Blue Origin’s NS-24 mission on August 3.

title: Suspecting Wife Of Having Affair, Man Poisons His Children, Dies By Suicide: Cops
content: Suspecting his wife of having an affair, a man poisoned his two children, aged 7 and 2, and then died by suicide, said the police, adding that the woman and her lover have been arrested.

title: Cloudy Sky With Light Rain Predicted For Delhi Tomorrow: Weather Office
content: A cloudy sky with rain is likely in the national capital on Sunday, the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) said while predicting light rain or drizzle.

title: In Rs 3,000-Crore Anil Ambani Loan Fraud Case, Probe Agency Makes 1st Arrest
content: Making its first arrest in connection with the Rs 3,000-crore loan fraud case against companies of Anil Ambani's Reliance Group, the ED has taken the managing director of a company into custody for submitting fake guarantees worth Rs 68.2 crore.

title: Man Who Slapped Passenger Can Never Fly With Us Again: IndiGo
content: IndiGo has banned an individual from all its flights after a video showed him slapping a co-traveller on board a Mumbai-Kolkata flight.

title: Lookout Notice Against Anil Ambani In Rs 3,000-Crore Loan Fraud Case: Sources
content: In more trouble for Reliance Group Chairman Anil Ambani, the Enforcement Directorate has issued a Look Out Circular against him in connection with the alleged Rs 3,000-crore loan fraud case, sources said on Friday.

title: Two Red Panda Cubs Born In Sikkim's Himalayan Zoological Park After 7 Years
content: Two Red Panda cubs were born in the Himalayan Zoological Park (HZP), Bulbuley near Gangtok, after seven years, an official statement said.

title: "No Claims Filed In 24 Hours After Bihar Draft Electoral Rolls Released": Poll Body
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) on Saturday said that not a single claim or objection has been filed by any political party in the first 24 hours of the publication of the draft electoral rolls in Bihar.

title: After Trump's 25% Tariff Move, PM Modi's Big 'Swadeshi' Push
content: Days after US President Donald Trump announced that a tariff of 25%, plus an unspecified penalty because of energy imports from Russia, would be imposed on India, Prime Minister Narendra Modi has made a push for 'swadeshi' (made in India) products.

title: Overthinking Common In India, 1 In 3 Use Tech Tools Like ChatGPT For Support
content: Choosing a dish at a restaurant or making a gift purchase decision, a growing number of Indians are turning to technology to navigate overthinking, which has become a part of daily life of the people, as per a survey.

title: ISRO Sets Up Station In Ladakh To Simulate Life On Moon, Mars
content: ISRO’s HOPE station in Ladakh will serve as a testing ground for future Moon and Mars missions by simulating extreme space-like conditions on Earth.

title: NIA Raids 14 Locations In Karnataka In Hindu Activist Suhas Shetty Murder Case
content: The sleuths of the National Investigation Agency (NIA) are conducting simultaneous raids at 14 locations on Saturday across Mangaluru district in connection with Hindu activist and rowdy sheeter Sushas Shetty murder case.

title: BSF To Probe Chinese-Made Drone Found Near Tripura Border With Bangladesh
content: The Border Security Force (BSF) would conduct a thorough study of the 'Made in China' mark drone, found near the India-Bangladesh border, officials said on Saturday.

title: Home Ministry Allows Visitor Visa For Pakistani Woman Deported After Pahalgam Attack
content: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) has informed the Jammu, Kashmir and Ladakh High Court that it has decided to grant a visitor's visa to Rakshanda Rashid, a Pakistani woman who was deported from Jammu after the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: He Stabbed His Pregnant Wife To Death, Called Cops, And Waited
content: A pregnant woman was stabbed to death by her husband in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut. The husband, Ravi Shankar, killed his seven-month pregnant wife, Sapna, inside a locked room before calling the police on himself.

title: Rahul Gandhi Claims Arun Jaitley Threatened Him. His Son Replies
content: Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi drew a sharp counter from late BJP leader Arun Jaitley's son this morning, over his claim that the government had sent him to threaten him against pursuing the farm law protests.

title: 2 Arrested For Online Death, Rape Threats To Actor Divya Spandana
content: Ramya filed a complaint against 43 social media accounts for sending her obscene messages, along with rape and death threats.

title: "Made-Up Conversion Story": Tribal Girls After Bail To Kerala Nuns
content: Kumari Lalita Usendi, her voice firm but emotional, says she feels good that she has been proven innocent. "Jyoti Sharma sent bhaiya and sister to jail without any proof. Today we got bail, and it feels good," Ms Usendi said.

title: UK Defends Online Safety Law Amid X's Free Speech Criticisms
content: The UK government on Saturday defended a new online safety law following harsh criticism from social network X.

title: For Nipah prevention, learning to live safely with bats is the way forward, say experts
content: Experts seek to explore airborne transmission risks and advocate for behaviour modification. As bats have a vital role in the environment, it is better to alter human behaviour to have minimal human-bat interactions than trying to remove them from their habitat, say experts.

title: Gear up to adopt technology and shift to natural farming, Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu advises farmers in Andhra Pradesh
content: Hinting at deployment of Kisan Drones, the Chief Minister says in the future farmers will be intimated in advance the crops to be cultivated based on the weather pattern and water availability; he also vows to complete the Polavaram irrigation project by December 2027

title: Students told to keep up with changing pace of technology
content: Self-discipline can be an individual’s greatest strength, and above all, ethics and integrity must be a constant compass, that will outlast any trend and outshine any achievement, says Secretary of Department of Higher Education

title: IAF airlifts essential items to Manipur villages cut off by landslides
content: “Multiple agencies, including the NHIDCL, are working to clear the debris and restore the road connectivity in the region,” officials said

title: No PoP idols in Dharwad district, says DC
content: Task forces formed to check entry of such idols into the district; officials told to take strict action against violators

title: Karnataka High Court finds no fault in government’s policy of not providing roster-based reservation for honorary posts of anganwadi workers
content: The High Court of Karnataka said that the policy of the State government in not providing roster-based reservation for the posts of anganwadi workers is not contrary to constitutional provisions as these posts are not civil but only honorary

title: Ensure timely supply for fertilizers to farmers: official
content: Deputy Commissioner raises concern over the functioning of BMCRC at Karnataka Development Programme  review meeting at Ballari; officials told to ensure regular health check-ups and treatment of children

title: Applications for admissions to colleges run or aided by West Bengal government dip sharply
content: Most academicians attribute this fall in numbers to the unusual delay of almost three months from the publication of Higher Secondary exam results to the commencement of the college admissions process

title: Centre’s green signal for Mananchira–Vellimadukunnu Road upgrade as single stretch
content: Malaparamba–Vellimadukunnu work to begin early next year after Mananchira–Malaparamba stretch is completed

title: TDB withdraws from Vallasadya amid protests, Palliyoda Seva Sangham to continue paid feast
content: All bookings made through the board for aAugust 3 feast to be held on Sunday has been cancelled with immediate effect, says TDB chief

title: Three arrested for poisoning drinking water in school
content: The accused reportedly wanted to get headmaster transferred; 11 schoolchildren were hospitalised after drinking water at the school

title: 14 fishermen attacked off Kodiyakkarai coast
content: The assailants, who spoke Tamil and were suspected to be of foreign origin, took away GPS devices, mobile phones and diesel and fishing net from Tamil Nadu fishermen

title: Expected rebound in export growth will not happen quickly amid U.S. tariff row: CUB MD
content: About ₹1,200 crore of the  ₹55,000-crore book has exposure to exports. Out of that, ₹200 crore will be focused on U.S. exports, says CUB MD

title: In counter to Congress protest against ECI, BJP to stage its own demonstration in Bengaluru on August 5
content: The BJP’s former and incumbent MPs, MLAs and MLCs will stage the dharna in front of the Mahatma Gandhi statue on the Vidhana Soudha premises on August 5, at the same time when the Congress will stage its protest against ECI at Freedom Park

title: Nalam Kaakkum Stalin health camps inaugurated in Tiruchi
content: On Day One, 1,483 people benefited from the health camp in Tiruchi city; ENT, dental, psychiatry, physiotherapy, cardiology, skin, and general surgeries covered under the scheme

title: Additional polling stations mooted in Chittoor district
content: In tune with the draft rationalisation module for 2026, the number of polling stations in Chittoor would be increased from 1,776 to 1,974, says DRO K. Mohan Kumar

title: Election Commission of India doubles annual remuneration of booth level officers to ₹12,000
content: The ECI had also approved a special incentive of ₹6,000 for the BLOs for the SIR of the voters’ list starting from Bihar

title: Our Responsibility to Children scheme scaled up to cover 1,227 schools
content: ORC was launched for early identification, intervention, and prevention of issues faced by children.

title: 46.86 lakh farmers receive financial assistance under Annadata Sukhibhava-PM KISAN in Andhra Pradesh
content: Launching the scheme, Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu, while terming it as a historic moment, says that of the ₹3,175 crore released as part of first instalment, the State’s share is ₹2,343 crore, while the Central government has given ₹832 crore

title: Plus One applicants from north Kerala districts get short shrift this year too
content: Despite a 30% hike in capacity, nearly 54,000 applicants cannot be accommodated across higher secondary, vocational, ITI, and polytechnic colleges

title: ‘Face Wash and Go’ campaign intensified in Sri Sathya Sai district
content: Special teams stop vehicles plying at night and prompt the drivers to wash their faces before resuming journey

title: IndiGo bans passenger for 30-days for assaulting a co-traveller
content: The assailant and the victim were released on bail on August 2, 2025; the arrest was made under Section 170 of the BNSS that deals with prevention of commission of cognisable offences

title: Annadata Sukhibhava: ₹138.16 crore disbursed to 2.05 lakh farmers in Chittoor
content: The remaining two instalments of the scheme will be credited to farmers’ accounts in October and January, says Transport Minister

title: Youth are India’s future, says Andhra Pradesh Governor
content: At the 13th Convocation of Vignan University, Abdul Nazeer commends the institution’s interdisciplinary approach and positions Amaravati’s Quantum Valley as a key driver of India’s quantum mission, urging students to champion innovation and ethical leadership

title: Constitution under siege, BJP doing ideological coup to replace republic with theocratic state: Sonia
content: “Today, the Constitution is under siege. The BJP-RSS, which never fought for freedom or upheld equality, now uses its power to dismantle the very framework it long opposed,” Sonia Gandhi said

title: DIG Varun Kumar urges Madras High Court to restrain NTK leader Seeman from making defamatory allegations
content: Justice K. Kumaresh Babu agrees to hear his plea on August 6 and directs the counsel for Seeman to file a counter affidavit by then

title: Meghalaya probing disappearance of coal from depots
content: A High Court-appointed committee said in a recent report that 3,960.95 metric tonnes of coal, declared as extracted and inventoried, had vanished from two designated storage sites

title: First LVM3 launch vehicle equipped with semi-cryogenic stage slated to fly in 2027
content: The three-stage LVM3 had its first experimental flight in December, 2014. The semi-cryogenic stage is designed to make it even more formidable, enhancing payload capability while keeping costs down, says ISRO chief.

title: Darshan case: Two arrested for posting vulgar comments about actor Ramya
content: They allegedly posted vulgar comments against Ramya in response to a post she had put up on the developments in the Supreme Court on the murder case in which Darshan is the prime accused

title: It’s painful to see the hills vanish, but change can happen here too, says Madhav Gadgil
content: As climate change accelerates, we are likely to witness an even more unequal distribution of suffering, with the poorest bearing the heaviest burden, renowned environmentalist and recipient of the UNEP’s ‘Champion of the Earth’ award, Professor Madhav Gadgil, said

title: Election Commission has become PM Modi's 'puppet': Mallikarjun Kharge
content: “But today, the Constitution is in danger. Leaders in power are talking about changing the Constitution. If the BJP had won 400 seats in the 2024 elections, they would have changed the Constitution,” says Mallikarjun Kharge

title: Namma Metro facilitates organ transport from Whitefield to R.R. Nagar for transplant
content: According to BMRCL officials, this is the second instance of organ transportation via metro in India, following the first initiative in Hyderabad in January, 2025.

title: Supreme Court sets aside High Court order granting anticipatory bail on condition to resume conjugal life
content: The apex court said that the HC should have considered the prayer for pre-arrest bail entirely on its own merit instead of imposing a condition, which is not traceable to section 438(2) of the erstwhile Code of Criminal Procedure

title: Prajwal Revanna, former Hassan MP, sentenced to life imprisonment for rape of employee in Karnataka
content: A Special Court in Bengaluru pronounced the quantum of sentence after convicting the 34-year-old Prajwal in one of the four sexual abuse and rape cases registered against him, on August 1

title: Dharmasthala burials: Advocate accuses SI of coercing complainant into retracting allegations
content: In a mail addressed to the SIT office and a few SIT officers, advocate Ananya Gowda claimed that her client was allegedly threatened by Sub-Inspector Manjunath Gowda in the SIT camp office at Belthangady

title: Rahul Gandhi will defeat Narendra Modi and defend Constitution: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy
content: Stating that Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi turned down the opportunities to become PM, Telangana CM said that Narendra Modi never stepped away from power since 2001

title: Student Police Cadet is Kerala’s contribution to world, says Minister P. Rajeeve
content: SPC plays a significant role in inculcating among students awareness about law, discipline, social commitment, humanitarian values and sense of justice, he says.

title: Guntur Municipal Corporation cracks down on hotels, restaurants causing traffic disruptions
content: He ordered the seizure of a tiffin stall for converting a road into a parking zone despite repeated warnings

title: Former Chief Justice of India D.Y. Chandrachud vacates official residence
content: Recently, a controversy had arisen over his stay at the official residence of CJI at 5, Krishna Menon Marg, New Delhi, beyond permissible time

title: Two arrested in West Bengal for beating up Muslim men carrying cattle for agricultural work
content: Two persons were arrested by Asansol-Durgapur Police Commissionerate. The assault was led by a BJP youth leader Parijat Ganguly.

title: Ahmedabad Air India crash: U.K. families await update on DNA-matched remains
content: Keystone Law, which has been working with aviation experts to assist many of the families who lost loved ones in the June 12 crash, called for urgency in the process this week

title: 2K Games details gameplay changes for NBA 2K26
content: the ProPLAY Motion Engine has overhauled how players move on the court . the engine will reduce the phenomenon of players "skating" over the floor . this also includes a new collision system that aims to be more reliable than motion capture animations used previously .

title: ⚾ Making sense of the MLB trade deadline
content: the 2025 trade deadline is in the books . the San Diego Padres and Houston Astros made surprising moves that rocked the deadline . ESPN experts debate what's real moving forward . it's not because they're all sleeping giants .

title: 'He's pretty much a rookie': The good and bad of J.J. McCarthy at Vikings camp
content: if there is anyone inside the Minnesota Vikings organization with a license to speak freely about J.J. McCarthy, it's Justin Jefferson . the team's star receiver spent the offseason working with his new quarterback . "you definitely have to have patience," Jefferson says .

title: CFP 2025: 32 teams can make the College Football Playoff
content: the 12-team college football playoff will again include the five highest-ranked conference champions . there are 32 teams -- the most in the CFP era -- with at least a 10% chance of reaching the playoff . the list will shrink by November, but below it starts with 32 teams ranked in order of their percentage chance .

title: MLB trade deadline winners and losers: What we loved -- and don't understand
content: this year's deadline didn't have star players on the move, like Juan Soto in 2022, or the volume of last year . the Twins traded back former star Carlos Correa, while the Athletics traded closer Mason Miller to the Padres for Leo De Vries, one of the best prospects .

title: What you missed from recruiting this summer
content: the busiest 60 days of the annual recruiting calendar are officially behind us . 155 prospects in the 2026 ESPN 300 made commitments in an avalanche of summer recruiting business from June 1 to July 31 . only 16 uncommitteds remain in the ESPN 300 as of Saturday morning .

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 NFL training camps: Vikings' Justin Jefferson rehabbing hamstring on side
content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL, and our 32 team reporters are on the ground each day following all the action . the latest intel on standouts, highlights, position battles, depth chart movement, cut decisions and, of course, the quarterback room . we have updated depth charts for all 32 teams .

title: How will Miller and Suarez split closing duties?
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . former Rays starter Blake Snell has not toed a major league rubber since early April . the veteran lefty has been sidelined with left shoulder inflammation .

title: How did the Cowboys and Parsons get here? Plus league reaction and what’s next
content: quarterback dak Prescott and receiver ceeDee Lamb didn't get their respective new deals done until close to the season . on friday, parsons posted on social media that he is requesting a trade . "i no longer want to play for the Dallas Cowboys," he wrote .

title: Shibu Soren critical: Former Jharkhand CM on ventilator in Delhi hospital
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: Nayara Energy hit by EU sanctions; looks at Indian oil companies to offload exports
content: the TOI Business Desk is a vigilant and dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant business news from around the world to readers of the Times of India . the desk ensures that TOI readers are well-informed about the ever-changing and dynamic world of commerce .

title: Eye on China: India deploys warships to Southeast; boosts military ties
content: International Friendship Day: 10 gift ideas for your best friends 10 books that can help calm anxiety 10 wild animals that sleep for most of their day! 8 budget friendly-decor ideas that can lighten up any space! 10 lesser-known wild cats of India Rice bran to grapeseed: Natural priming oils for a flawless makeup glow Gauahar Khan’s top 10 glamorous looks 10 things to know before adopting a Desi dog or puppy 'Kingdom' actress Bhagyashri Borse's breathtaking pictures In pics: Elegant looks of actress Nandita Swetha

title: 'Not funny': Sex toy lands on WNBA court again
content: a sex toy was thrown on the court during a game for the second time this week . a whistle was blown to stop play during the third quarter of the Golden State Valkyries' 73-66 victory over the Chicago sky . an official kicked it aside before it was picked up and removed .
